text: is a Japanese city in Kōchi Prefecture on the island of Shikoku.Deal, William E. (2005). Handbook to Life in Medieval and Early Modern Japan, p. 74. It is the capital city of the prefecture.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2002). "Kōchi" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 538. The city of Kōchi is at Urado Bay on the Pacific coast.Nussbaum, "Kōchi prefecture" at p. 538. It has been recognized as a core city since 1998.Jacobs, A.J. "Japan's Evolving Nested Municipal Hierarchy: The Race for Local Power in the 2000s," Urban Studies Research, Vol. 2011 (2011), p. 8 [PDF 8 of 14]; "Kochi" at Triposo.com; excerpt, "... first core city on Shikoku". Retrieved 2012-12-5. ==History== Kōchi developed as a castle town which was the center of Tosa Province. ===Timeline=== * 1889 – Modern city was incorporated * 1904 – Tram service began * 1951 – Connection to the national rail network ==Notes== ==Other websites== * Kōchi official website ; * Category:Cities in Shikoku Category:Settlements in Kōchi Prefecture Category:1889 establishments in Asia Category:1880s establishments in Japan
title: Kōchi, Kōchi
